newsitem.title: USA: Dow seen higher at open, chip stocks seen firm.
newsitem.headline: Dow seen higher at open, chip stocks seen firm.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to open higher on Tuesday, boosted by new evidence of improving conditions in the semiconductor industry, share analysts said.

The Semiconductor Industry Association reported late Monday that its book-to-bill ratio, which measures new orders against shipments, rose to 1.15 in November, a better than expected improvement from October's revised 1.11 reading.
"Chip stocks are higher in Europe and that should help the market get off to a good start," said Larry Wachtel, market analyst at Prudential Securities.
